item.title: Report X-2024110895
item.description:
Report X-2024110895

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS FOUND IN THE HAZMAT AUDIT AREA. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER USED THE DECSION TREE TO FIND THE CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER USED THE CORRSIVE RESPONSE SHEET AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE UNLOAD DOOR 8. FOLLOWING DECISION TREE AND USING REQUIRED PPE, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND MOVED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024110375
item.description:
Report E-2024110375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-21
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Airgas Specialty Products
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver heard an audible sound of air leaking when making his exit off the interstate to enter the plant. Upon arrival into the plant gate, he pulled over and discovered that the ammonia vapor was leaking out of the PRV. He then pulled the truck and trailer into our plant and shut the gates. From there we dispatched (2) additional trucks from Granite City IL to remove the contents from the trailer. At appox 0500 on Oct 22nd all ammonia was removed from the leaking trailer. The trailer was then transported to our maintenance vendor. They entered the tank and saw that a baffle had broken inside the tank and rested against the PRV and bending it causing it leak.
